communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of scholarships available to VMI Cadets from any source and the selection criteria for those scholarships (needs-based, athletic, merit, or other). There are only a few listed on your website, yet your website and the Alumni Agencies material indicate there are a number of them available, and even for the Alumni Agencies-funded scholarships, VMI makes or participates in the selections. This makes the information releasable under the FOIA.  If there is a website that lists these, I am willing to pull them from there, but unlike almost every other Virginia IHE, VMI does not have an easily locatable source for this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Obama Presidential Library: Drafts of March 20th 2014 Statement on Ukraine

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all drafts of President Obama's "Statement by the President" on Ukraine that was announced on the White House lawn on March 20th of 2014. Please include a search for all comment drafts, research material, briefing papers, printed emails or text messages related to the statement. Please be sure to include a search of pre-statement emails that transmitted all statement drafts before it was given.

Here's a link to the transcript of the comments:

https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/the-press-office/2014/03/20/statement-president-ukraine

Of particular interest is why the statement "This is not our preferred outcome." was included in this statement in relation to the discussion of sanctions targeting the Russian economy.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Obama Presidential Library: Marc Raimondi emails (marc.a.raimondi@nsc.eop.gov) referencing Yevgeny Prigozhin

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Obama Presidential Library: Marc Raimondi emails (marc.a.raimondi@nsc.eop.gov) referencing Yevgeny Prigozhin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any emails either to or from Marc Raimondi's email address (marc.a.raimondi@nsc.eop.gov) that mention the Russian oligarch and founder of the Wagner Paramilitary Group, Yevgeny Prigozhin, in the subject line, email body, or in an attachment.

Limit the search to the approximate time of Mr. Raimondi's time as "Director of Strategic Communications" for the NSC. The approximate time frame is from November 1st 2016 to January 20th 2017.

Biographical information which details his time as "Director of Strategic Communications" at the end of the second Obama administration: 

https://nationalsecurity.gmu.edu/marc-raimondi/

Search terms:
Yevgeny Prigozhin
Yevgeny Viktorovich Prigozhin
Евгений Пригожин

If certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for the commitment to transparency and I look forward to having this request resolved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware
